fields.headline: The way we worked
fields.bodyText: London plastic surgeon Mr Willis works on a patient's face with an electrical apparatus that had recently replaced the cosmetic knife. Although accounts of plastic surgery had been recorded in ancient Egyptian and Indian societies, mostly to rectify facial disfigurements, it wasn't until the 1930's that cosmetic surgery began to become an acceptable way to improve beauty. Techniques that were perfected treating injured soldiers in the first world war were used for the first time to enhance physical appearance.
